description:
A tiny state park tucked away near Tygh Valley, OR. Not a destination on its own, but worth a stop if you happen to be passing through the area. A 0.3mi trail leads down into the canyon past the remains of an old hydroelectric plant that operated until 1963. There's another short waterfall 300 yards downstream.

  • The falls are at their most impressive in the spring in full spate.

Approach

Descent

Exit

Red tape

Sadly, rappelling of the falls is prohibited.

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background
name: White River Falls State Park
